title: Labour turkeys could be stuffed at the next election, whether it be before or after Christmas
text:
Labour has had enough trouble deciding what it thinks about Brexit, especially whether to have a referendum on it at all. And it has not been any easier for the Opposition to decide how soon it should allow a general election.

Make no mistake, Labour insists it wants an election, despite rejecting both of Boris Johnson's attempts to secure one. After demanding at first that the Prime Minister let the Benn Bill pass before an election could be allowed, Jeremy Corbyn shifted the goalposts - insisting that Mr Johnson needed to go further by letting Brexit be delayed first.

With the UK on the verge of an Article 50 extension, that should clear the way for an election as soon as early December -...
description: Labour has had enough trouble deciding what it thinks about Brexit, especially whether to have a referendum on it at all.
